description: System-generated unique identifier for a column definition in the metadata catalog; used to link related records.
Name of the business object (table or view) that this column definition belongs to.
Logical field name as exposed by the business object.
Physical source table that supplies data for the business object.
Physical source column mapped to the logical field.
User-facing label or caption used in screens and reports.
Application data type for the field; guides validation, formatting, and storage.
Referenced table for a lookup or foreign-key relationship.
Referenced key column in the related table used to resolve the relationship.
Value automatically assigned when none is provided during insert; may use expressions.
Flag indicating the database auto-generates sequential values for this field.
Application relationship key or alias identifying the linked parent entity; likely used for lookups. Confirm with SME.
Indicates whether this configuration has been reviewed and approved for use.
Administrative notes captured by configuration tools; not used in runtime logic.
Date and time when this configuration row was last updated.
Indicates whether empty or NULL values are permitted.
Bitmask of behavior flags controlling UI, validation, and synchronization rules.
Marks records delivered by the base product rather than site-specific customization.
Site-level override for whether the field can be left empty.
Site-level default value applied when none is provided.
Indicates the site has disabled or removed this column configuration.
Reference to an allowed-values list or enumeration that constrains input.
Indicates the field is non-editable in the application.
Site-level override that forces the field to be non-editable.
Site-specific bitmask override applied to behavior flags; likely computed or stored override. Confirm with SME.
Default filter clause restricting records used for lookups or data selection associated with this field.
